reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you to great hostesses. It was great accommodations, in a great location with great hosts. We were in the main house on the 2nd floor. We loved access to the front porch. Our room was huge! Breakfast was what we expected: coffee, jiuce, fruit and baked something.. House is on the carriage tour route, with the attention going to across the street. Parking was available. Location was great.
reviews.title: Lovely!
Great place, great people and great value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was our first time to Charleston and this B & B could not had been better. The location was wonderful we could walk anywhere in minutes. Vic and Anne was very helpful. The breakfast was very good and we could sleep late (Anne makes the muffins and they are very good). The garden was lovely, we sat out one night enjoying a end to a wonderful day. On our next trip to Charleston we will stay with Vic and Anne again.
reviews.title: Lovely, historic Bed & Breakfast establishment!

reviews.text: We stayed in this B&B when we were attending a wedding in Charleston. The owners, Vic and Anne, could not have been more helpful and welcoming and gave us lots of advice as to where to go and what to do! The suite was large and comfortable with an attractive balcony overlooking the garden. It was furnished in an individual and tasteful manner. The location is fantastic, only a ten minute walk from the Battery. If you want the 'real flavour' of ante-bellum Charleston, this a very good choice!
reviews.title: Charming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Charming room, great location for historic downtown, walk to the Battery, lovely garden, priced right.
reviews.title: A Good B&B, In Heart of Historic Charleston

reviews.text: We stayed during the month of May. The location was excellent. Easy to walk to everything. Parking was no problem. We did park in the driveway , but also had no trouble finding street parking. This may have been because it was not the high tourist season. Our room was OK. The bed was very comfortable. However the room was decent size but they just had too much furniture in it and there was barely room to walk. The TV was circa 1965. It was about 10 inches wide and got about 3 channels. This did not matter to us, but if you do like a room with a TV, you will be upset with this TV. The bathroom was fine. However, they could do better at cleaning the room. It was not dirty but it really could have used a good dusting. I bent down to pick something up and was amazed at the dust on the floor. Also, the moldings on the bathroom doors were really dirty. Just the type of stuff that you don’t have to clean every day but must be done at least every 3-4 weeks and it was not done. Also, there were about 4 wire hangers in the closet. It does not cost much put a half dozen plastic hangers in the closet. One large towel is given per person. It would have been nice to have 2—but it was no biggie. Breakfast is left in the small refrigerator in your room. This worked for us as you can sleep in and eat when you want. It was OK. ½ of a grapefruit, a packaged muffin, some cereal, coffee, tea and juice. Adequate but nothing special. There is a table in the room to eat at, but since there was no place to sit out suitcase on, we had our suitcase on the table…so it made it tough to eat. It was disappointing that there was no place to sit outside. In a city known for its gardens and porches, there was not a chair on the porch or a place to sit in a very unkempt garden. This was a drag, since it would have been nice to sit on the porch or in the garden in the evening. The male host was very nice and helpful. He gave us directions, helpful hints and seemed very engaged and eager to speak with us about the history of the city. However, his wife was polite but did not seem like she wanted to be bothered.
reviews.title: 36 meeting St--great location but average room and breakfast

likes.disliked: — room was too crowed and needed dusting

reviews.text: Where do I begin to tell you of our experience?
reviews.title: Abandoned with no hope
Yuk!
reviews.text: We arrived and there was no one present; a note was taped to the front door telling us our room was on the second floor, up the spiral staircase. We ascended the rickety staircase, which wobbled more as you approached the top of the staircase.
The key was in the lock (which we'll discuss later). The room was well air conditioned and had a beautiful queen size bed.
reviews.title: Fabulous stay!!

reviews.text: The only closet is in the bathroom, and is too small.
reviews.title: Disappointing
Made our Honeymoon very special
reviews.text: Anne,Vic and the Staff made our Honeymoon a special time for us.. They went above and beyond what we thought.

reviews.title: Charming!
reviews.text: My husband and I would definantly recommend 36 Meeting Street a place to stay.

reviews.title: Treat yourself to the 36 Meeting Street B&B
